title: Question 22
prompt:
Significant deforestation has occurred in a certain region since the year 1990. Animal species P, Q and R are inhabitants of this region. The table shows the populations of these species in this region in the years 1990, 2000 and 2010.

Researcher 1: Species Q has not been significantly impacted by deforestation in the region
Researcher 2: Species P has been more impacted by deforestation than species R
Researcher 3: Species Q preys on species P and species R
Researcher 4: Species P and R have been impacted by deforestation, and possibly other factors as well.

Which researcher’s hypothesis is the least likely?
feedback: Researcher 2’s hypothesis is the least likely. Though it is reasonable to hypothesize that species P and R have been impacted by deforestation, the population of species R has decreased at a much faster rate that of species P.
